Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant in refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding due to inconsistencies in testimony
Legal_Provision: Section 96 or 97 of IRPA (basis for refugee protection)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in account of being sought by Chinese authorities and knowledge of Christianity
Proceeding_Type: Refugee determination and subsequent judicial review
Application_Error: Board's focus on trivial religious knowledge criticized but not deemed fatal
Evidence_Ignored: Limited emphasis on minor religious knowledge details
Application_Factor: Credibility of witness and consistency of testimony
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the Board unreasonable in discrediting the applicant?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA and related jurisprudence on credibility
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility due to contradictions in key aspects of claim
Legal_Provision_Cited: Relevant sections of IRPA regarding refugee eligibility and credibility
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent testimony on central elements of claim
Procedural_Fairness: No breach found despite criticism of Board's reasoning
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of credibility assessment
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, case law on standard of review
Procedural_Issue: Appropriateness of judicial intervention in administrative credibility findings
Omission_Type: Failure to provide consistent account of religious practice and persecution
